runkoserver.controller

Class ContentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • runkoserver.controller.ContentController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/content")
public class ContentController
extends Object
    Controller class for HTTP requests related to Content objects.

    • Method Detail

      • getContent

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=GET)
public String getContent(org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                                    @PathVariable
                                                                                    Long id,
                                                                                    org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                    Principal principal)
        GET-method for a view with the information of a specific Content object.
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - Spring object for redirect attributes
        id - id of the Content whose information will be shown
        model - Spring model object
        principal - To get who is logged in
        Returns:
        path to the html file that shows Content information

      • contentEditForm

        @RequestMapping(value="/edit/{id}",
                method=GET)
public String contentEditForm(@PathVariable
                                                                                              Long id,
                                                                                              org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                                              Principal principal,
                                                                                              org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        GET-method for rendering the form to modify existing content.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the content to be edited
        model - object for spring to use
        principal - Spring object that knows who is logged in
        redirectAttributes - Spring object to carry redirect attributes
        Returns:
        path to the content creation form html file if the user is the owner of the content, otherwise redirect to front page

      • contentNewForm

        @RequestMapping(value="/contentform",
                method=GET)
public String contentNewForm(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        GET-method for the form view to create a new Content.
        Parameters:
        model - object for spring to use
        Returns:
        path to the content creation form html file

      • postContent

        @RequestMapping(value="/contentform",
                method=POST)
public String postContent(org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                                             @RequestParam(required=true)
                                                                                             String name,
                                                                                             @RequestParam(required=true)
                                                                                             String textArea,
                                                                                             @RequestParam(required=false)
                                                                                             List<Long> areaIds,
                                                                                             Principal principal)
        POST-method to create a new Content.
        Parameters:
        redirectAttributes - a Spring object to carry attributes from this method to the one that the user is next redirected to
        name - Name of new content
        textArea - text field of content
        areaIds - List with ares where content is connected
        principal - To get who is logged in.
        Returns:
        the URL path that the user will be redirected to

      • updateContent

        @RequestMapping(value="/edit/{id}",
                method=POST)
public String updateContent(@PathVariable
                                                                                             Long id,
                                                                                             org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                                             @RequestParam(required=true)
                                                                                             String name,
                                                                                             @RequestParam(required=true)
                                                                                             String textArea,
                                                                                             @RequestParam(required=false)
                                                                                             List<Long> areaIds,
                                                                                             Principal principal)
        POST-method to modify a Content.
        Parameters:
        id - identifies which content is modified
        redirectAttributes - Spring object for redirect attributes
        name - title of the content
        textArea - text area of the content
        areaIds - list of areas where content is connected
        principal - who is logged in
        Returns:
        back to index

      • deleteElement

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=DELETE)
public String deleteElement(@PathVariable
                                                                                          Long id,
                                                                                          org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes,
                                                                                          Principal principal)
        Deletes an Element and any possible references to it.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Element to be deleted
        redirectAttributes - a Spring object to carry redirect attributes
        principal - who is logged in
        Returns:
        the URL path that the user will be redirected to

      • bookmarkedContent

        @RequestMapping(value="/{id}",
                method=POST)
public String bookmarkedContent(@PathVariable
                                                                                            Long id,
                                                                                            @RequestParam(required=false)
                                                                                            String whereICome,
                                                                                            Principal principal,
                                                                                            org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        POST-method to add a new bookmark for the currently logged in user.
        Parameters:
        id - which area is subscripted or unsubscripted
        whereICome - tells which URL we should redirect
        principal - Spring object that knows who is logged in
        redirectAttributes - Spring object to carry redirect attributes
        Returns:
        redirect URL to the page the user came from
